title: Software Technology Experience
brief: The software world have a wide variety of problem, one must be familiar with multiple tools to select the right tool for the job.

cards.title: Java
cards.description: My main programming languages for developing desktop applications and backend systems. Used to developed application such as Quoridor, GroupUp, and Pet Adoption App.

cards.title: Typescript
cards.description: Used to develop all web related projects. Example such as this website, sudoku solver web, and web multiplayer maze.

cards.title: C++
cards.description: Primarily used in competitive programing due to the performance benefit it offered over other heavy runtime programing languages.

cards.title: Python
cards.description: Mainly for AI/ML project, Django applications and some automation. Some usage includes TSP visualizer, CTF laptop lending system, and Knowledge-Base-Backend.

cards.title: C#
cards.description: Used during the internship to develop Windows desktop applications to validate networking hardware and perform security verification in the device ROM.

cards.title: Rust
cards.description: Recently learned programming language. It offers some safety memory guarantee while being extremely performent. More project coming soon.

extraCards.title: Ocaml
extraCards.description: A language that introduced me to the functional programming paradigm. Mainly used in the course COMP-302 Programming Languages and Paradigms.

cards.title: React
cards.description: My favorite web development framework. Its component-based system makes creating stateful web application rapidly.

cards.title: Next.JS
cards.description: The framework used to create this site. It offers the ability to create server-side rendering react application or exported as a static site

cards.title: Tailwind CSS
cards.description: A utility first CSS framework that help build responsive layout with minimal effort. Also used in this website.

cards.title: HTML
cards.description: The most basic building block of the web. I am familiar with majority of the syntax and practices.

cards.title: CSS
cards.description: The fundamental of styling html component and create responsive layout. I am familiar with majority of the CSS syntax and concepts.

cards.title: Spring
cards.description: A Java framework that offer extension to perform data access and web integration. Used for creating GroupUp and Pet Adoption APP.

cards.title: Django
cards.description: A web framework that uses model template view design pattern. It allow user to develop secure web application rapidly. Used for Laptop Lending System and Knowledge Base Backend.

cards.title: PostgreSQL
cards.description: An open source SQL relational database management system. Used in all my backend projects.

cards.title: JUnit 5
cards.description: A Java testing framework that is commonly used to test Java applications. Used in GroupUp, Quoridor, and Pet Finder.

cards.title: Mocha
cards.description: A JavaScript/TypeScript test runner that is commonly used. Used in Sudoku Solver Web and this website.

cards.title: Chai
cards.description: A JavaScript/TypeScript assertion library that provides TDD style syntax and many useful apis. Used in Sudoku Solver Web and this website.

cards.title: Pytest
cards.description: A python testing framework mainly used to write test for APIs. Used in Knowledge Base Backend

cards.title: Cucumber
cards.description: A software tool that support behavior driven development (BBD). Used in Quoridor and GroupUp

cards.title: Git
cards.description: The most popular version control system for software development.

cards.title: NPM
cards.description: Node package manager for installing, updating, and publishing Javascript packages for a project.

cards.title: Figma
cards.description: UX design tool for creating UI designs. Used to create some icons and visual for this website.
